summary:
## COMMUNITY PULSE
(No Reddit/HN data provided in source material - unable to complete this section with actual community sentiment)

## KEY DEVELOPMENTS

- **xAI hemorrhaging talent** - Half of founding team has now departed, with Musk framing exits as "push not pull" while pivoting messaging to interplanetary ambitions and IPO talk
- **Modal Labs raising at $2.5B valuation** - AI inference infrastructure startup in funding talks, signaling continued investor appetite for picks-and-shovels plays in the AI stack
- **OpenAI disbands mission alignment team** - Company eliminates dedicated alignment group while also reportedly firing policy exec over discrimination claim related to chatbot content restrictions
- **Glean fighting for enterprise AI layer** - Company positioning to own the AI interface inside corporations, competing for strategic position between foundation models and end users
- **Amazon exploring AI content marketplace** - May launch platform for media sites to sell training data to AI companies, potentially standardizing content licensing

## WHAT THIS MEANS FOR TP

The enterprise AI layer battle (Glean) and infrastructure plays (Modal) confirm what we're seeing: companies want AI capabilities without model complexity. Position TP's automation consulting as the bridge - we help clients implement without betting on volatile vendors. The xAI chaos and OpenAI alignment team dissolution also strengthen the "build stable internal workflows, don't wait for Big Tech" narrative.
